question: Which relationship typically involves method calls from one object to another without implying ownership?
In Java, what relationship is established when a 'Library' class contains a 'Book' class but the book can exist independently of the library?
Which type of relationship is indicated by 'A wheel is part of a car'?
If a 'University' class has a collection of 'Department' objects and departments cannot exist without the university, what relationship is this?
Which relationship allows one object to interact with another object, typically through method calls, without implying ownership?
Which of the following best describes inheritance?
In which relationship does one class contain a reference to another class as a member variable, implying ownership but not strict dependency?
What is the relationship called when a 'Library' has 'Books' and each book can exist without the library?
Which relationship is most appropriate for modeling 'A car has an engine'?
In Java, which relationship allows multiple objects to share the same instance of another object?
What type of relationship is demonstrated when a 'Manager' class has a reference to an 'Employee' class but employees can exist independently of the manager?
Which type of relationship is indicated by 'A sentence consists of words'?
In which relationship does one class use another class as a parameter in its methods, allowing interaction without ownership?
What relationship is implied when a 'Team' class has 'Player' objects, and players can exist without the team?
Which of the following describes a 'strong has-a' relationship?
What relationship is depicted when an 'Employee' class contains an 'Address' class and the address cannot exist without the employee?
In which relationship does the contained object cease to exist if the container object is destroyed?
Which type of relationship is indicated by 'A library contains books'?
What relationship best describes 'A person has a name'?
Which relationship is used when one class needs to perform an action on behalf of another class?
